title: Skydiver doesn't let losing his leg stop him from jumping
description: Anderson Cooper talks about skydiving with Dion Callaway, who was reunited with his prosthetic leg after losing it at 10,000 feet. Anderson Cooper Full Circle airs Monday, Thursday and Friday at 6p E.T.

title: Amanpour presses India government spokesman over Covid
description: In an interview with CNN's Christiane Amanpour, Narendra Taneja, a spokesman for India's ruling Bharatiya Janata party, said that responsibility for the devastating second wave of Covid-19 now sweeping the country belongs "first and foremost" to the government.

title: Michael Cohen makes prediction about Trump and 2024
description: CNN's Alisyn Camerota spoke to Trump's former personal attorney Michael Cohen about federal investigators executing a search warrant on the home and office of Rudy Giuliani.

title: America's economy is rebounding. But it is still in a deep hole
description: America is emerging from the worst of the pandemic, and that will mean some eye-popping figures when the government releases economic growth data Thursday. But the big jump — fueled by resurgent consumer spending after a year in lockdown — will still be starting from a deep hole.

title: Why a Black Captain America changes everything
description: Note: This op-ed contains spoliers for 'The Falcon and the Winter Soldier.'

title: Overwhelmed cemetery shows toll of India's Covid-19 crisis
description: CNN's Sam Kiley reports from a cemetery in Delhi, India, amid one of the world's worst outbreaks of Covid-19. India's total number of cases has surpassed 18 million, with 379,257 new cases on Thursday, another global record, according to figures released by the country's health ministry.

title: Germany puts anti-lockdown group under surveillance for possible extremist ties
description: Germany's intelligence service is putting some anti-lockdown activists under surveillance because of concerns they are attempting to undermine the legitimacy of the federal state.

title: Kamala Harris to be first vice president with wax figure at Madame Tussauds
description: Kamala Harris will soon be making more history when she becomes the first United States vice president to have a figure on display at the Madame Tussauds wax museum in New York City.

title: Utah Jazz set a new franchise record after thrashing the Sacramento Kings
description: The Utah Jazz set a new franchise record for most points in a single game on Wednesday as they thrashed the Sacramento Kings 154-105.

title: A false facial recognition match sent this innocent Black man to jail
description: In February 2019, Nijeer Parks walked into the Woodbridge Police Department to clear his name.

title: The global chip shortage has come for iPads and Macs
description: Even America's biggest company can't save itself from a global shortage of crucial computer chips.

title: The country's Covid-19 nightmare has the potential to have massive repercussions around the world
description: There is a split scenario unfolding as the world battles the pandemic.

title: Inside Miley Cyrus' exuberant Los Angeles home -- designed by her mother
description: When it came time for Miley Cyrus to decorate the 6,800-square-foot Los Angeles home she bought last year, the singer looked to one of the people who knows her best: Her mother and manager, Tish Cyrus.

title: Turkey prepares for its first national lockdown as Covid-19 cases rise
description: Turkey is bracing itself for its first national coronavirus lockdown as infection rates continue to climb in the country, now the highest in Europe.

title: He was innocent. But a facial recognition 'match' got this man arrested
description: Nijeer Parks couldn't have committed the crime. That didn't stop police from arresting him based off of a false facial recognition match. Here's why the technology can often misidentify Black people, with serious consequences.

title: 'Skeleton' Navalny appears for first time since ending hunger strike
description: Jailed Kremlin critic Alexey Navalny appeared in court via videolink on Thursday to appeal a defamation conviction, in his first public appearance since he went on hunger strike.

title: Prince William and Kate mark 10-year wedding anniversary with newly released pictures
description: Prince William and Catherine, the Duchess of Cambridge, have released two new photographs to mark their 10-year wedding anniversary.

title: Officer posted a TikTok mocking LeBron James' views on police. His department says it will be dealt with internally
description: After an Idaho officer posted a TikTok video mocking NBA star LeBron James' comments about the use of force by police, his employer, the Bellevue Marshal's Office, said it was addressing the issue internally.

title: Crochet culture is the internet trend that's both soothing and sustainable
description: They say the devil finds work for idle hands, but after a year of intermittent lockdowns and social starvation, the hobbies many of us have chosen to busy ourselves with are surprisingly wholesome. Lately, there has been a deluge of crafting content on TikTok, YouTube, Pinterest and Instagram, as crocheting and knitting shed the senior stereotype and emerge as fashion's newest fad among Gen Z.

title: PSG 'collapsed completely' in its Champions League semifinal against Manchester City
description: Paris Saint-Germain was "emotional and aggressive in a stupid way" according to former Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger after it threw away its lead in the Champions League semifinal clash against Manchester City.

title: Recap Biden's joint address in 3 minutes
description: President Joe Biden delivered his first joint address to Congress and made the case for sweeping new government programs.

title: Bryce Harper escapes injury after 97 mph pitch to face
description: Philadelphia right fielder Bryce Harper, who left the Phillies' Wednesday night road game against the St. Louis Cardinals after getting hit in the face by a pitch, avoided serious injury.

title: China successfully launches first module of planned space station
description: For more than two decades, the International Space Station has orbited 227 nautical miles above Earth with more than 200 astronauts from 19 different countries enjoying stints aboard.

title: Is it 'Zoom face' or is the pandemic aging you?
description: Is that face in the mirror looking a bit, well, older these days?

title: US investigating possible mysterious directed energy attack near White House
description: Federal agencies are investigating at least two possible incidents on US soil, including one near the White House in November of last year, that appear similar to mysterious, invisible attacks that have led to debilitating symptoms for dozens of US personnel abroad.

title: Patty Tavatanakit: The golfer who admits it's 'odd' to think she's a major winner
description: Since winning her debut major at the ANA Inspiration, Patty Tavatanakit's life has dramatically changed.

title: Federal indictment for Ahmaud Arbery's accused killers is one step closer to justice, mother says
description: The federal indictment of three men accused of killing Ahmaud Arbery represents "one step closer to justice," his mother told CNN.

title: Forgotten for half a century, this rare bean could save Sierra Leone's coffee industry
description: About 200 miles southeast of Sierra Leone's capital, agricultural researcher Daniel Sarmu made the discovery of a lifetime in the steep and humid Kambui Hills.

title: Philippines tells China to mind its own business over maritime drills
description: China has no business telling the Philippines what it can or cannot do within its waters, Manila's Defense Ministry said on Wednesday, rejecting Beijing's opposition to its ongoing coast guard exercises.

title: Officer involved in botched raid that resulted in Breonna Taylor's death announces retirement
description: A Louisville police officer who was involved in the botched raid that resulted in the death of Breonna Taylor has announced his retirement, saying that it was in the "best interest" of his family.

title: India is one of the world's top 10 buyers of Covid vaccines. It still has nowhere near enough
description: India has the world's biggest vaccine producing capacity but is suffering a devastating second wave of coronavirus infections -- just as supplies of Covid-19 vaccines for its huge population are running low.

title: India's Covid-19 crisis is a problem for the world
Hong Kong passes new immigration law that could enable China-style exit bans
description: Officials in Hong Kong will soon be able to block people from entering or leaving the territory, raising concerns over the possibility of mainland Chinese-style "exit bans" being used to prevent activists and former lawmakers from leaving.

title: Factual ... but not perfect: Dale points out Biden's ad-lib in speech
description: CNN's Daniel Dale fact checks President Joe Biden's first prime-time speech to Congress, as well as the Republican party's rebuttal given by South Carolina Sen. Tim Scott.

title: The looming crisis in Brussels that no one is talking about
description: She's been a fixture of life in Germany for almost 16 years. But now the political stability that the country has enjoyed for so long under Angela Merkel is coming to an end as she prepares to stand down as Chancellor.

title: YouTubers face deportation from Bali over fake mask stunt
description: Two YouTubers are facing deportation from Bali after they made a prank video that depicted one of them breaking local mask laws.

title: Van Jones on Sen. Scott: The messenger was great, but the message was nonsense
description: CNN's Van Jones reacts after Sen. Tim Scott (R-SC) said America is "not a racist country" in the Republican rebuttal to President Joe Biden's joint address to Congress.

title: India is not the only Covid-19 hotspot in Asia
description: Covid-19 cases in Asia are rising especially in India and its neighboring countries. CNN's Kristie Lu Stout takes a look at the deteriorating situations in the hardest-hit regions in Asia.

title: Women lost $800 billion in income last year. That's more than the combined GDP of 98 countries
description: The fallout from the Covid-19 pandemic has been disastrous for women.

title: Hong Kong has fined a journalist for ticking a box. That shows the city's media freedoms are in jeopardy
Southern Thai food: Exploring the flavors of the country's 'spiciest cuisine'
description: The toughest reservation in Bangkok? It's almost certainly a place called Sorn.

title: Willow Smith reveals she is polyamorous on 'Red Table Talk'
description: The 20-year-old daughter of actors Will and Jada Pinkett Smith said she is attracted to "the freedom to be able to create a relationship style that works for you."

title: Harris and Pelosi make history at Biden's address to Congress
description: The imagery of President Joe Biden's address to a joint session of Congress will be notable Wednesday evening for what it will not include, with attendance dramatically scaled back to ensure social distancing amid the pandemic. But it will also be historic for what it will: two women will be sitting behind the President for the first time.
